articles.title: OPEC+ agrees to boost oil output after Saudi Arabia, UAE end standoff - Mint
articles.description: OPEC+ will boost oil output by as much as 400,000 barrels a day each month from August until all of its halted output has been revived..The deal will also give the UAE, Iraq and Kuwait higher output quotas from May 2022
articles.content: OPEC and its allies agreed to gradually add more oil supplies to the market after Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates resolved a dispute that was blocking the deal.
